Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Mussel Defensin MGD-1 (Mediterranean mussel defensin 1; mollusca/molluscs/mollusks, invertebrates, animals)
Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the invertebrate defensin family. Type 2 subfamily.
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.8925841] Gram-positive bacteria:Micrococcus luteus (MIC=0.08 μg/ml);Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli (MIC=6.4 μg/ml), Vibrio alginolyticus (MIC=6.4 μg/ml), Vibrio splendidus (MIC=1.6 μg/ml), Vibrio P1 (MIC=6.4 μg/ml).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.8925841] The plasma is capable of causing 20% of the total hemolysis.
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: [Ref.8925841] The protozoan P. marinus is not killed by pure peptide, even at a concentration of 16 μg/ml.
Sequence Information.Structure Description: The signature of MGD-1 is that of the arthropod defensins which range in length from 34 to 51 amino acid residues with 6 conserved cysteines engaged in three intramolecular disulfide bridges. They are characterized by the presence of a flexible amino-terminal loop, a central amphipathic
Sequence Information.Function: Active against both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria but is not cytotoxic towards human erythrocytes or protozoa.

Literature.Title: A member of the arthropod defensin family from edible Mediterranean mussels (Mytilus galloprovincialis)
Literature.Author: Hubert F, Noel T, Roch P.
